Author: CoinKing88#1540
Content: I calculated my daily KMD mining rewards but i am sure i am making a huge mistake. I should be able to do 29 megahash/s with my RX 480, according to a calculator i would be getting 1700 KMD PER DAY. That cant be right?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: only 1080 KMD per day for miners, so 1700 would indeed be impossible

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also impossible to get 29 Msols on any single ASIC, fastest is about 0.2Msols. maybe you are calculating SHA256 hashes? that has no use for mining equihash

Author: newvulcan#4719
Content:
Hi. I'm having an issue with mining Pirate and Komodo with komodod and knomp on my Linux server. I thought I had these working, but on closer inspection although my mining machines are being authorised, they keep coming up with a "re-joining" message and no shares are being recorded (no invalid ones either). I have another coin, Zaddex which is working fine.

My pirate.json file is:

{
"name": "PIRATE",
"symbol": "ARRR",
"algorithm": "equihash",
"txfee": 0.0001,
"requireShielding": true,
"sapling": true,
"disablecb":true,
"privateChain":true,
"burnFees": true
}


and my komodod start command is:

./komodod -addnode=136.243.102.225 -ac_private=1 -ac_supply=0 -ac_name=PIRATE -ac_reward=25600000000 -ac_halving=77777

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @newvulcan do not use `disablecb` for PIRATE

Author: Alright#0419
Content: That's basically the one exception that `disablecb` won't work for properly. You can use it for solo mining, but if you need to split the cb into multiple vouts, it will not work
